page.title: 01ALLET &CALLESTICK AREA,TRURO
page.content: This block, north-west of the city of Truro, is mainly farmland, with the hamlets of Allet & Callestick each of about 20 houses of different styles. There is no housing development in the area & no amenities apart from Allet Chapel.The block is bisected by the A30 trunkroad.The B3284 Perranporth- Truro road crosses the southern part & the A3075 the west of the block.There are many single-track lanes & farm tracks, but very few footpaths. The landscape of Cornish-hedged fields is broken up by many small streams in tree-lined valleys, some flowing north to the sea at Perranporth,others south to join the River Kenwyn.Several earth mounds indicate ancient settlement;the old mine engine-house near Callestick is a sign of mining history; nearby is a small working sand & gravel-pit.
